content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the whole gang is there, the guys are watching football, the girls are cooking Thanksgiving dinner.

content.speaker: The Guys
content.text: Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Awww!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, it’s your Thanksgiving too, y’know, instead of watching football, you could help.

content.speaker: The Guys
content.text: We will. (they don’t move)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, Rachel, you wanna put the marshmellows in concentric circles.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No Mon, you want to put them in concentric circles. I want to do this.
(Rachel sticks a marshmellow into Monica’s nose. Monica takes it out of her nose by closing one nostril, and blowing.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Every year.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, for once, I am going to sit down and try to watch one of these things. (just as she sits down).

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Halftime.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, who wants to ah, throw the ball around a little, maybe get a little three on three going?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! That would be sooo much fun!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, can I play too? I’ve never played football, like ever.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great, you can cover Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, no, I don’t, I don’t really wanna play.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on man! You never want to do anything since you and Janice broke up.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s not true! I wanted to wear my bathrobe and eat peanut clusters all day. I wanted to start drinking in the morning. Don’t say that I don’t have goals!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler, you have to start getting over her. All right, if you play, you get some fresh air, maybe it’ll take your mind off Janice, and if you don’t play, everyone will be mad at you ‘cause the teams won’t be even. Come on.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, all right, I’ll play.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yay!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Let’s do it! Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you wanna play football?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Um, Monica and I aren’t supposed to play football.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Says who? Your mom?

content.speaker: Monica and Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, every, every Thanksgiving um, we used to have a touch football game called the ‘Geller Bowl.’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, no, you say that proudly.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Anyway, Ross and I were always captains, and um, it got kind’ve competitive and one year, Geller Bowl VI, I accidentally broke Ross’s nose.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was soo not an accident. She saw I was about to tag her, so she threw her big fat grandma arm elbow right into my face. And just keep running.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: To score the winning touchdown, by the way.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, ho, ho, ho, you did not win the game, the touchdown didn’t count, because of the spectacularly illegal, oh and by the way savage nose breaking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I won the game.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah! Then how come you didn’t get the Geller Cup?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um, there was a Geller Cup?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, it was the trophy you got if you won the game. But our Dad said, ‘nobody won that game, ‘ and he was sick of our fighting, so he took the trophy and… (pauses to collect himself, as he is on the verge of tears saying this) threw it in the lake.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And was the curse lifted?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Anyway. That’s when our Mom said we were not to play football ever again.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what, I think we should play a game. I mean come on, it’s been twelve years.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can I see you for a second?
(they walk over to the sink and discuss it for a moment)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Once!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, we’re gonna play.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But wait a minute though, how are we gonna get there, though, because my Mom won’t let me cross the street.

content.description: The Park, the gang is warming up for their football game.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Let’s bring it in.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait no, honey, honey throw it to me, throw it to me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here you go. (throws her the ball)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That almost hit me in the face.
content.parenthetical: knocking it down instead of catching it

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, we have to pick captains.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And then Tineals.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, so how do we decide that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, why don’t we just bunny up.

content.speaker: Rachel, Chandler, and Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica and Ross
content.text: Bunny!
content.parenthetical: holding both of their hands above their heads making rabbit ears with their fingers.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, looks like Ross and I are captains. Okay, so um, I bunnied first so that means I get to pick first. Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, I’m your best friend.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sweetie, don’t worry you’ll get picked. Chandler.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe.
(Phoebe kisses Rachel on the cheek, then joins her team.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sweetie, now I pick you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You don’t pick me! You’re stuck with me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. All right. So let’s see, let’s play from the trash can, to the lightpost. Right. Two hand touch, we’ll kick off.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right people listen, I’ve got exactly twenty-eight minutes before I have to baste again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow! Just like in the pros.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Huddle up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, huddle up, right over here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait for me! Wait for me! Wait for me! Oh cool, this is my first huddle.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, so what do you guys really think of Chandler?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, Phoebe you know what you’re doing right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, Joey’s gonna catch it, and you and I are gonna block.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s block?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, I thought you said you know what you’re doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I thought you meant in life.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Break.
(Chandler is getting ready to kick off, Ross is holding the ball between his foot and finger.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The ball is Janice. The ball is Janice. (goes to kick the ball but kicks Ross’s foot instead.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oww!! Son of a…!! Ow! Come on!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sorry. I’m sorry. Y’know what, we’re just gonna throw it.
(Chandler throws the ball to kick-off.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I got it. (catches the ball)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Go! Go! Go!
(Joey runs up field and fakes out Ross and scores a touchdown. His team all celebrates the touchdown.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Score!! 7 to nothing!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you okay?
content.parenthetical: coming over to Ross, who is just getting up

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, let’s go!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Losers walk!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, losers talk!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, no, actually losers rhyme.
[cut to later, Ross’s team has the ball.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Twenty-three!! Seventy-four!! (Ross stands up and looks at him) You wanna go shotgun?
content.parenthetical: coming up under center, just like a real quarterback does, and puts his hands between Ross’s legs.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hike!

content.speaker: Monica and Joey
content.text: One-Mississippi. Two-Mississippi. Three-Mississippi.
(Rachel runs a quick slant.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Over here!
(Chandler throws her the ball, which she drops.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I almost caught that one!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Great! Now, the score is 7 to almost 7.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, (to Chandler) this play, I want you to do a down and out to the right. Okay. Break!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait, what am I gonna do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You, you go long.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait, how long?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Until we start to look very small.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Break!!
[cut to later, Monica’s team has the ball.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Set…hike!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: One-Mississippi, two-Mississippi, switch! Switch! Switch!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, no, no, no!
(Monica throws the ball over Joey’s head, it’s stopped from rolling away by a very beautiful woman.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Haaaaa! Hey-hey, thanks for stopping our ball.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: You are playing American football?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Wow, your like from a whole other country.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I’m Dutch.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi-hi, I’m Joey.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I’m Margha.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sorry Dutch, I didn’t get that last little bit.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Joey, do you wanna play football or you wanna.. (sees Marhan) Hi, I’m Chandler.

content.speaker: Margha
content.text: Hello, Chandler.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Her name is Dutch, and also Marklan.

content.speaker: Margha
content.text: Margha.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Mar-klan.

content.speaker: Margha
content.text: Mar-gha.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mar-haaaan.
[cut to Ross and Monica.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on guys! Let’s go! Come on, it’s second down.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, hello, it’s third down.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No it’s not, it’s second.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It just amazes me that your still pulling stuff like this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pulling what? It’s second down.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, it’s second down. (turns away) Take all the second downs you need.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I heard that!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I said it loud.
[cut to Chandler, Joey, and Margha.]

content.speaker: Margha
content.text: It is okay, if I stay and watch?

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Yeah! Why don’t you stick around. You can sit right there.
(she goes and sits down)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, that went well.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I think so.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I was thinking about ah, asking her for her number.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks man, but I think it makes a stronger statement if I ask for it myself, y’know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa-ho, whoa! No, I was thinking about y’know for me, as a part of that whole getting over Janice thing you were talking about.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah, that. All right, means that much to ya, I’ll let you have her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks. What, let me have her?! What do mean? Like if you didn’t I wouldn’t have a shot?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well I don’t like to say it out loud, but, yeah! Don’t feel bad man, we all have our strengths. You’re better with numbers and stuff.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Math!! You’re giving me math! All right, look y’know what, forget about it, you go for the girl, we’ll see who gets her.
[cut to later, in Ross’s huddle.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler, I want you to run a post pattern to the left, okay. And sweetie..

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I know, go long. Y’know, it’s like all I’m doing is running back and forth from the huddle.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well ah, you wanna just stay out there?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Can I see that for second.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.
(Rachel takes the ball from his hands and bounces it off of Ross’s forehead and Chandler catches the rebound.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Hut! Hike!
(Chandler runs around behind Ross, who pitches him the ball. Chandler runs upfield, and Joey knocks the ball out of his hands.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fumble!
(Joey starts to return the fumble and Chandler grabs Joey’s shirt and rips it off of his back.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What the hell’s the matter with you?! This is my favourite jersey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well now you have two. Hey, I am good at math.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, that’s it. Y’know I was still gonna let you have her. But now, forget about it. Prepare to feel very bad about yourself.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Well, I’ve been preparing for that my entire life! Or something about you that’s mean!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, come on guys, let’s go! Tie score, and we’re runnin’ out of time. Forty-two!! Thirty-eight!! Hike! (the timer sounds as Monica throws the ball to Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh I got it!! (catches the ball) Oh! Ew! Broken boob! Ow!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs, run!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Run, Phoebe, run!
(Phoebe runs and scores a touchdown.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Touchdown!! Touchdown!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, hello, the buzzer buzzed. It doesn’t count.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: After the snap!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Before the snap!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: After!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Before!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now, does it really matter?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yes!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, okay, I made a touchdown. It was my first touchdown. So?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh Pheebs, that’s great. It doesn’t count.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Does so count!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Cheater, cheater, compulsive eater.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what, that’s fine, maybe you haven’t grown up, but I have.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-ho, okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dead leg!! (kicks him in the thigh.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ow! Ow! Okay, okay, fine, fine! All right, you wanna win by cheating, go ahead, all right. Phoebe the touchdown does count, you win.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Woo-yay!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! Listen, I’m not gonna go through this with you again, okay. Just once I wanna beat when you can’t blame it on the broken nose, the buzzer, or the fact that you thought you were getting mono. Let’s just call this, tie score and it’s halftime.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, first of all, I don’t play with cheaters, and second of all, you know I had swollen glands!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what? I’ll think you’ll play.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh really! Why is that?
[cut to Monica and Rachel’s.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because the winner gets this!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The Geller Cup.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is everybody else seeing a troll doll nailed to a two by four?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, good.

content.description: The park, the gang is returning to play the second half of the game.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, where in the hell did you get that?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: When Mom and Dad drove you to the hospital to get your nose fixed, I swam into the lake and fished it out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That cup is mine!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No it’s not! You want it, you’re gonna have to win it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, so are we not having dinner at all?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on Phoebe, let’s go! Come on, it’s time to get serious, huddle up. Joey, keep your head in the game.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s hard, y’know, his huddle is closer to Dutch girl.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right look, if I take Chandler out of the running will you be able to focus?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you gonna do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, you just make sure that Chandler catches the ball, I’ll take care of the rest.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Break!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here you go!
(Joey throws the ball to Chandler)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler! Chandler!
(Chandler catches the ball and starts to run upfield.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi.
(just as he gets in front of Margha, Monica comes up and tackles him)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Whoa! Whoa!! Tackled by a girl! Bet ya don’t see that everyday, do ya?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What’s with the tackling?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! I just touched him and he went over.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, you wanna play rough, we can play rough.
(They both stare each other down as we hear ‘Let’s get ready to r-r-r-rum-ble!!!’)
(A long football sequence follows.)
[Sequence 1: Monica throws the ball over Chandler’s head to Joey who catches it for a touchdown, and starts to dance in celebration. Chandler then tackles him, and he starts to dance in celebration.]
[Sequence 2: Monica runs upfield and stops, waiting for a pass. Ross runs over and pulls her pants down, steps in front of her and intercepts the pass.]
[Sequence 3: Chandler throws a pass to Ross, who catches it. Phoebe starts screaming and runs up to him and tries to tackle him. But all she ends up doing is running around his waist and screaming.]

[Sequence 4: Ross hikes the ball to Chandler, and the camera pans down to show Rachel standing deep in the end zone, playing with her gum. Something hits her on the head and she looks up to see where it came from.]
[Sequence 5: Monica hands the ball off to Phoebe, who runs up field and delivers a fore-arm shiver to Chandler, knocking him over and scores the touchdown, and she yells…]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I love this game!!
[cut to Ross who walks up to Rachel who is eating a baked pretzel.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, where’d you get that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I went really long.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Forty-two to twenty-one! Like the turkey, Ross is done!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s no surprise that your winning, ‘cause you got to pick first, so you got the better team.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re so pathetic! Why can’t you just accept it, we’re winning because I’m better than you.
(Ross makes a ‘Yeah. Right.’ sound.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, what a great argument, exhaling! All right, y’know what, I’ll prove it to you, okay. I’ll trade you Joey for Rachel, and I’ll still win the game.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! The guys against the girls? See, that’s ridiculous Monica, because I’m only down by three touchdowns.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, then bring it on! Oh, unless of course your afraid you might lose to a bunch of girls.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine, fine, Rachel your with Monica, Joey you’re with me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can not believe your trading me!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on Rach, come on. Let’s see what’s it like to be on a winning team for a change.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you gonna let me play?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right then.
[cut to the guys’ team.]

content.speaker: Margha
content.text: The game is over, we eat now?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no, the game’s not over, we’re just switching teams.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, Chandler finds me so intimdating that it’s better if we’re on the same team.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right. Okay, let’s play. Let’s go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No ah, hold on a second Joe, where do Dutch people come from?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah well, the ah, Pennsylvania Dutch, come from Pennsylvania.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And the other ah, Dutch people, they come on from somewhere near the Netherlands, right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nice try. (to Margha) See the Netherlands is this make believe place where Peter Pan and Tinker Bell come from.

content.speaker: Margha
content.text: Oh, my.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Enough with geography for the insane, okay? Let’s play some ball, guys.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, whoa, no, no, I-I’m not playing with this guy, now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine with me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, y’know what, let’s just cut to the chase here. Okay? Heidi, which of my boys do you like?

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: What are you doing? What are you doing? What are you doing?

content.speaker: Margha
content.text: Which do I like?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, y’know for dating, general merriment, taking back to your windmill…

content.speaker: Margha
content.text: Well, if I had to chose right now, which by the way I find really weird, I would have to say, Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait a minute! Wait a minute! She obviously didn’t understand the question.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you don’t you have Captain Hook explain it to her.

content.speaker: Margha
content.text: I’m sorry, Joey, that is my chose.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You hear that! That is her chose, mister I’ll let you have her! I win! You suck! I rule all! A mini-wave in celebration of me!! (does the wave.)

content.speaker: Margha
content.text: I’m now thinking I would like to change my answer to, no one.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wh-what?

content.speaker: Margha
content.text: I now find you shallow and um, a dork. All right, bye.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nice going. You just saved yourself a couple months of sex.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what, it doesn’t matter, ‘cause she picked me. Me! From now on I get the dates and you have to stay home on Saturday nights watching Ready, Set, Cook!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Save the breakthroughs for therapy, okay. The clock is ticking. We have no time, and we are losing, we are losing to girls.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re not gonna lose to girls.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! It’s 42-21!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This sucks, I was just up by that much!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are we playing football or what? Come on you hairy-backed Marries.
[cut to the girls huddle.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We have to do this. We are playing for women everywhere. Okay, just think about every lousy date that you ever had, okay, every guy who kept on the TV while you’re making out…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! You dated someone with a glass eye too?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on, okay, come on this is for all womankind. Let’s kill ‘um!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!!! Kill ‘um!!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, no, well I want to kill them to, but their boys, y’know how are we gonna beat three boys?
(Another football sequence follows)
[Sequence 1: Chandler is running past Phoebe with the ball, Phoebe flashes him, he stops and stares dumbfounded at her. Phoebe then runs up and takes the ball away.]

[Sequence 2: Phoebe throws the ball, and it’s intercepted by Joey, who starts to run up field. Rachel jumps on his back in order to try and tackle him, but she doesn’t slow him down. Monica and Phoebe then both grab her legs in order to stop Joey, who still manages to fight through the tackle and score the touchdown.]
[Sequence 3: Chandler is running with the ball, Phoebe flashes him again, but Chandler covers his eyes, and keeps running. He then runs into a tree at the end of the field.]
[cut to the girls huddle]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, we still have a minute and a half to go, and we’re down by two points. Two points… (she gets interrupted by the guys, who are doing a slow-motion high five.) Phoebe you do a button-hook again. Rachel, you go long.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Come on! Don’t make me go long. Use me. They never cover me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, there’s a reason.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God, I’m not lame, okay. I can do something. I can throw, would you let me throw, come on this is my game too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on Mon, let her throw the ball.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right Rachel, you sweep behind, I’ll pitch it to you, you throw it down field to Phoebe. All right. Break.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you! Break!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thirty-two! Seventy-one! Hike!
(Phoebe snaps the ball to Monica, who pitches back to Rachel.)

content.speaker: The Guys
content.text: One-Mississippi! Two-Mississippi! Three-Mississippi!

(They all rush toward Rachel, who panics and runs away. She runs out of the park and up along the fence, she then comes back into the park and runs past Monica, as she gets to Monica, she throws the ball at Monica, and it hits her in the eye.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m so sorry! Are you okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! I’m not okay!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry, they were just all coming at me, and I didn’t know what to do.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thirty seconds left on the timer!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, okay, so we get to take that stupid troll thing home!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on! Come on! Hurry! We’re running out of time! Huddle up!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Oooh! Oh, this is our last huddle, yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, Phoebe get open. Rachel, go long.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Break!

(In slow motion, Phoebe snaps the ball, Rachel goes long. Joey and Chandler and all over Phoebe, leaving Rachel wide open. Ross starts to rush Monica, who sees Phoebe is double covered, in desperation she throws to Rachel. We see flying through the air, and then Rachel running underneath it, then the ball, then Rachel again, then the ball, then Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey staring at it in shock. Then with the grace of Jerry Rice (no offense to Jerry Rice), Rachel catches the ball, and she stops and spikes the ball. Both Phoebe and Monica erupt in celebration.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I got a touchdown! We did it!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey-hey-hey Rachel, funny thing. Actually, the ah, end zone starts at that pole, so you’re five feet short, so we win!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait-wait-wait-wait! So, explain something to me though, if, if nobody tagged Rachel, then isn’t the play still going.
(they all start to dive for the ball and Monica and Ross grab it at the same time.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let go! Let go!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Let go! I’m a tiny little woman!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Guys! Guys! Come on! It’s Thanksgiving, it’s not important who wins or loses. The important thing is, (to Joey) the Dutch girl picked me! Me! Not you! Holland loves Chandler! Thank you, Amsterdam! Good night!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ow!!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel, Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey are eating Thanksgiving dinner.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We should defiantly play football more often. Maybe there’s a like league we could join or something.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Isn’t there a national football league.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes. Yes, there is, they play on Sundays and Monday nights.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh shoot! I work Monday nights.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, this stuffing is amazing. Do you think we should bring them some?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: When they’re hungry enough, they’ll come in.

content.description: The park, it’s dark outside and Monica and Ross are still fighting over the ball.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Let go!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! You let go!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How come it’s always us left in the field holding the ball?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know. I guess the other people just don’t care enough.
(It starts snowing.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! It’s starting to snow.
(They both look up, and watch it start to snow. Then they both start fighting for the ball again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Gimme the this!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Let go!
